title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 August 2013 - XWiki
content:
<kstuart> has quit  
01:48 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
02:01 <polx> has quit  
06:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <mflorea> hmm, velocity error on 5.2M1 release notes page  
09:27 <mflorea> hmm, not anymore.. strange  
09:32 <vmassol> mflorea: should http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9223 be closed?  
09:32 <mflorea> yes, I'm documenting it in the release notes and then I'll close it  
09:32 <vmassol> ok  
09:41 <vmassol> upgrading jenkins  
09:51 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <mflorea> has quit  
09:53 <vmassol> mflorea1: ping  
09:54 <vmassol> I'm trying to understand your comment at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8742?focusedCommentId=76930&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-76930  
09:54 <vmassol> you say:  
09:54 <vmassol> " you didn't take into account the use case when the user clicks on the "You can edit this page to create it." link. So a user goes to a non existing page and sees a link to create that page so he clicks it. He is taken to the create form where he has to choose the page template, but the rest should be pre-filled, including the page name."  
09:54 <vmassol> but I don't see this when I try it  
09:55 <vmassol> hmm actually it seems my fix has been rolled back  
09:55 <vmassol> checking commits  
09:55 <mflorea1> I didn't rollback  
09:56 <vmassol> I don't get the behavior of my fix anymore  
09:56 <vmassol> I'm getting the previous behavior now  
09:56 <mflorea1> make sure you have a template defined (with a template provider)  
09:56 <vmassol> ?  
09:56 <mflorea1> well, I didn't rollback anything  
09:56 <vmassol> I'm talking about default behavior  
09:57 <mflorea1> the current behavior takes you directly to edit mode, that's why I wrote:  
09:57 <mflorea1> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8742?focusedCommentId=76931&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-76931  
09:59 <mflorea1> in the commits tab I see only one commit, which touches only createinline.vm, but the redirect decision it made in CreateAction, so your commit can't change the behavior  
10:01 <vmassol> strange, AFAIR this change was enough to make it work for me. Checking  
10:35 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <msmeria> has quit  
12:28 <polx> has quit  
12:42 <mflorea1> has quit  
13:57 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <GuillaumeF> Hello all. I'm here to report what seems to be an API breakage. We used to use xwiki.mailsender.sendMessageFromTemplate to send mails from 5 of our applications, with xwiki 4.5.3. Now that we upgraded to 5.1, this method doesn't accept "xwiki.null" as one of the parameters  
13:59 <GuillaumeF> sendMessageFromTemplate(String from, String to, String cc, String bcc, String language, String documentFullName, VelocityContext vcontext)  
14:00 <GuillaumeF> We used to have 'xwiki.null'  for 'cc' and 'bcc', but it doesn't work anymore... How can we replace it? Do we have to put the same mail address there in cc and bcc than in 'to', to make it work ?  
14:54 <GuillaumeF> nobody? :(  
14:55 <vmassol> if it's a bug you should report it  
14:56 <GuillaumeF> When I see that it doesn't accept a certain kind of object anymore, I admit it's a feature and not a bug, but if nobody is aware about it, then I'll report it  
14:56 <GuillaumeF> thanks  
14:56 <vmassol> I don't know this domain so I cannot give you more info  
14:56 <GuillaumeF> I'll replace xwiki.null by the same mail address, because this is a critical command for us  
14:57 <GuillaumeF> method\*  
15:26 <polx> has joined #xwiki
